title: Code of Conduct
text: interest fostering open welcoming environment, contributors maintainers pledge making participation project community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, disability, ethnicity, gender identity expression, level experience, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity orientation.

title: Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes creating positive environment include: Using welcoming inclusive language respectful differing viewpoints experiences Gracefully accepting constructive criticism Focusing best community Showing empathy towards community members Examples unacceptable behavior participants include: use sexualized language imagery unwelcome sexual attention advances Trolling, insulting/derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical electronic address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

Project maintainers right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, ban temporarily permanently contributor behaviors deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful.

title: Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within project spaces public spaces individual representing project community. Examples representing project community include using official project e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event. Representation project may defined clarified project maintainers.

title: Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported contacting project team dol23asuka@gmail.com, pyh2982@gmail.com, harryikhchan@gmail.com. project team review investigate complaints, respond way deems appropriate circumstances. project team obligated maintain confidentiality regard reporter incident. details specific enforcement policies may posted separately. Project maintainers follow enforce Code Conduct good faith may face temporary permanent repercussions determined members project’s leadership.

title: Code of Conduct

text: Look GitHub issues bugs. Anything tagged “bug” “help wanted” open whoever wants implement .

text: can never enough documentation! Please feel free contribute part documentation, official docs, docstrings, even web blog posts, articles, .

title: Contributing to snapedautilityR
text: best way send feedback file issue https://github.com/UBC-MDS/snapedautilityR/issues. proposing feature: Explain detail work. Keep scope narrow possible, make easier implement. Remember volunteer-driven project, contributions welcome :)

title: Contributing to snapedautilityR
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("UBC-MDS/snapedautilityR", fork = TRUE). Install development dependences devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to snapedautilityR
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: How to use snapedautilityR
text: demonstrate use snapedautilityR package data science project.

title: How to use snapedautilityR
text: using penguins data iris data .
code: library(palmerpenguins) head(penguins) #> # A tibble: 6 × 8 #>   species island bill_length_mm bill_depth_mm flipper_length_… body_mass_g sex   #>   <fct>   <fct>           <dbl>         <dbl>            <int>       <int> <fct> #> 1 Adelie  Torge…           39.1          18.7              181        3750 male  #> 2 Adelie  Torge…           39.5          17.4              186        3800 fema… #> 3 Adelie  Torge…           40.3          18                195        3250 fema… #> 4 Adelie  Torge…           NA            NA                 NA          NA NA    #> 5 Adelie  Torge…           36.7          19.3              193        3450 fema… #> 6 Adelie  Torge…           39.3          20.6              190        3650 male  #> # … with 1 more variable: year <int> head(iris) #>   Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width Species #> 1          5.1         3.5          1.4         0.2  setosa #> 2          4.9         3.0          1.4         0.2  setosa #> 3          4.7         3.2          1.3         0.2  setosa #> 4          4.6         3.1          1.5         0.2  setosa #> 5          5.0         3.6          1.4         0.2  setosa #> 6          5.4         3.9          1.7         0.4  setosa

title: How to use snapedautilityR
text: Functionality function detects outliers given list, plots histogram given numeric features input data frame, plots bar charts categorical features input data frame. Function inputs df: dfFrame used plot features: List string feature names facet_column: Number columns Integer type facet options
code: plot_histograms(penguins, c("species", "flipper_length_mm", "bill_length_mm", "body_mass_g", "island"), 3) #> Warning: Removed 6 rows containing non-finite values (stat_bin).

title: How to use snapedautilityR
text: Functionality function generates pearson correlation plot list numeric features given data frame. Function inputs df: dfFrame used plot features: List string feature names
code: numerical_features <- c('Sepal.Length','Sepal.Width','Petal.Width') plot_corr(iris, features = numerical_features) #> Registered S3 method overwritten by 'GGally': #>   method from    #>   +.gg   ggplot2

title: How to use snapedautilityR
text: Functionality function detect outliers given list Returns threshold value lower bound upper bound outliers Plot violin plot observations. Function inputs s: list double contains data width: width ggplot. Default set 150 height: height ggplot. Default set 150
code: library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union detect_outliers(pull(iris["Sepal.Length"]), 150, 150) #> [[1]] #> [1] 3.15 #>  #> [[2]] #> [1] 8.35 #>  #> [[3]]

title: Authors and Citation
text: Harry Chan. Maintainer. Dongxiao Li. Author. Kyle Ahn. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Li D, Ahn K (2022). snapedautilityR: Provide useful EDA functions just lines code. R package version 0.0.0.9000.
code: @Manual{,   title = {snapedautilityR: Provide useful EDA functions with just a few lines of code},   author = {Dongxiao Li and Kyle Ahn},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000}, }

what: Provide useful EDA functions with just a few lines of code
title: Provide useful EDA functions with just a few lines of code
text: snapedautilityR open-source library generate useful function kickstart EDA (Exploratory Data Analysis) just lines code. system built around quickly analyzing whole dataset providing detailed report visualization. goal help quick analysis feature characteristics, detecting outliers observations data characterization tasks.

title: Provide useful EDA functions with just a few lines of code
text: plot_histograms: Plots distribution numerical, categorical text features detect_outliers: Generate violin plot indicates outliers deviate observations data. plot_corr: Generates Correlation Plots numerical (Pearson’s correlation), categorical (uncertainty coefficient) categorical-numerical (correlation ratio) datatypes seamlessly data types.

title: Provide useful EDA functions with just a few lines of code
text: can install released version snapedautilityR CRAN : development version GitHub :

title: Provide useful EDA functions with just a few lines of code
text: Documentation usage examples snapedautilityR can found .

title: Provide useful EDA functions with just a few lines of code
code: library(snapedautilityR) library(palmerpenguins) ## basic example code for each utility function  # detect_outliers function detect_outliers(c(1, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 9, 10, 13, 40))  # plot_corr function numerical_features <- c("bill_length_mm", "body_mass_g", "bill_depth_mm") plot_corr(penguins, features = numerical_features)  # plot_histograms function df <- penguins plot <- plot_histograms(df, c("species", "bill_length_mm", "island"), 2, 100, 100)

title: Provide useful EDA functions with just a few lines of code
text: recognize EDA (exploratory data analysis) preprocessing packages common R open source ecosystem. package aims things well, light weight. non exhaustive list EDA helper packages R include: dlookr package includes handful tools diagnose, explore transform data. DataExplorer package provides easy generate report, visualization feature engineering functions data analysis/predictive modeling.

title: Provide useful EDA functions with just a few lines of code
text: snapedautilityR created Kyle Ahn, Harry Chan Dongxiao Li. licensed terms MIT license.

title: Plot Correlation Matrix — plot_corr
text: function generates pearson correlation plot list numeric features given data frame.

title: Plot Correlation Matrix — plot_corr
text: df input data frame plotting. features vector characters represents features names. default, NULL (returns correlation plot numeric features).

title: Plot Correlation Matrix — plot_corr
text: ggplot object, correlation plot illustrates correlation numeric features interactively.

title: Plot Correlation Matrix — plot_corr
code: numerical_features <- c('Sepal.Length','Sepal.Width','Petal.Width')  plot_corr(iris, features = numerical_features) #> Registered S3 method overwritten by 'GGally': #>   method from    #>   +.gg   ggplot2

title: Plot Histograms — plot_histograms
text: Detect outliers given list. Plots histogram given numeric features input dfframe, plots bar charts categorical features input dfframe

title: Plot Histograms — plot_histograms
text: df dfFrame used plot features List string feature names facet_columns Number columns Integer type facet options

title: Plot Histograms — plot_histograms
text: ggplot object consists categorical numeric histograms.

title: Plot Histograms — plot_histograms
code: library(palmerpenguins) df <- penguins plot_histograms(df, c("species", "flipper_length_mm", "bill_length_mm", "body_mass_g", "island"), 3) #> Warning: Removed 6 rows containing non-finite values (stat_bin).
